column1: Torcy (French pronunciation: ​[tɔʁsi]) is a commune in the Seine-et-Marne department in the Île-de-France region in north-central France. It is located in the eastern suburbs of Paris
column2: 21.8 km (13.5 mi) from the center of Paris.

column1: Torcy is a sub-prefecture of the department and the seat of an arrondissement. The commune of Torcy is part of the Val Maubuée sector
column2: one of the four sectors in the "new town" of Marne-la-Vallée.

column1: Torcy is served by Torcy station on Paris RER line A.
Inhabitants of Torcy are called Torcéens.

The suburbanization and affluence of the Vietnamese population in France has resulted in a demographic shift in Torcy since the 1980s. Vietnamese businesses and community organizations have been established in Torcy
column4: contains one of the highest concentrations of Vietnamese people in France at 10% to 20% of the population. As of 1998
column5: about 5-6% of the city's population is made up of East Asians.

column1: There are ten public primary school groups (preschool and elementary) in Torcy
column2: along with three junior high schools and two senior high schools.Junior high schools:
